messages.subject: Michigan Audubon Society Presents Workshop for Homeschool Families
messages.msgSnippet: Hummers & Howlers with Cynthia Reynolds & The Organization for Bat Conservation Friday, March 3, 2006 9:00 am to 12:00 pm Kellogg Hotel & Conference Center-
messages.messageBody:
Hummers & Howlers with Cynthia Reynolds &
The Organization for Bat Conservation

Friday, March 3, 2006
9:00 am to 12:00 pm
Kellogg Hotel & Conference Center- East Lansing, MI

Featuring -

Nature Writing with Cynthia Reynolds-

This year's program features Cynthia Reynolds, award-winning
journalist and author of the new children's book The Far- Flung
Adventures of Homer the Hummer. The students will explore the world
of nature writing as Ms. Reynolds shares with them the process of
writing her children's story book. MAS will be selling her book
and Ms. Reynolds has graciously offered to provide each family with
a free educational teacher's guide. For more information about the
book and author please visit www.mittenpress.com/.

&

Creatures of the Night with the Organization for Bat Conservation-
Students will learn about creatures of the night from the
Organization for Bat Conservation as they discover the most
fascinating features and adaptations of many nocturnal animals
including bats, flying squirrels, owls, and more. Live animals will
be shown including bats, owls, and a few surprises. To find out
more about the work of OBC please visit www.batconservation.org.

The Details

Register Early - Enrollment is Limited

Registration opens a 9:00 am
Program starts at 9:30 am
Children & the families will have the opportunity to attend both
programs.
Recommended ages: 7 years old to 15 years old
Cost: $5 per a person or $ 2o family rate (for a family of five).
Group Rate: 20 or more people (includes parents & children) at $ 4 a
person

For more information:
Contact Jeanette Henderson at 517-886-9144 or email her at
programcoordinator@...

Sponsored by 

Clonlara School www.clonlara.org/
Express Yourself Promotion www.expressyourselfpromo.com/
Iosco Audubon Society www.michiganaudubon.org

To Register

Please call 517-886-9144 or email
programcoordinator@... with the following
information.

Names of everyone attending the workshop
Ages of the children
Address
City
State
Zip code
Phone #
Email

Please make checks payable to payable to the Michigan Audubon
Society and mail your registration information and payment by March
1, 2006 to:

MAS Children Workshop
6011 W. St. Joseph Hwy Suite 403
Lansing, MI 48917

Or you may call the office to pay via Visa or MasterCard.

Confirmation of reservation will be sent via email or mail and will
include directions.
